answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some sample contracts you may find helpful.
This is a sample contract between a city and a township for fire protection services from the Minnesota League of Cities.
http://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&sqi=2&ved=0CDUQFjAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.lmc.org%2Fmedia%2Fdocument%2F1%2Fcontractbetweencitytownfireprotection.pdf&ei=1iUDT8DYNsX10gGaiOmfAg&usg=AFQjCNHtX8kQ8e5pkOfASAG89SoGnE2GYA&sig2=D27vaQ1T0ewn8T1ttg64cA
Here is a similar sample contract from the Oklahoma State government.
http://www.ok.gov/OEM/documents/Sample%20Mutual%20Aid.pdf
I have also included two links from the Municipal Services Research Center of Washington. This link goes to list of cities that have some variation of shared services agreement in place for fire protection. They also link to the contract agreement from that city.
http://www.mrsc.org/subjects/pubsafe/fire/ig-fire.aspx#Joint
The other link lists places with a shared services agreement for first responders and EMS.
http://www.mrsc.org/subjects/pubsafe/emergency/ems.aspx#Contracts
I found a recent article which discusses the financial concerns of an existing fire protection service agreement between the village of Cayuga Heights, NY and the City of Ithaca, NY.  http://www.ithaca.com/news/ithaca/article_5c4f18d6-ff74-11e0-aaa8-001cc4c002e0.html
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Toni Shope
text:
A locality is looking for examples of contracts between smaller to mid-sized cities and towns and Volunteer Fire Departments and/or First Responders.  Any assistance is greatly appreciated. 
Thank you.
title: Contract Examples Volunteer Fire Departments First Responders
